general: A carbacephem antibiotic; Loracarbef activity is similar to Cefaclor.
The drug is no longer available in the U.S., but may be available in other regions.
There are no generic versions produced

adult_dose.usual_dose: 200 mg once daily to 400 mg po twice daily

adverse_effects: For class-wide adverse effects, see Cephalosporins, Overview.

pregnancy_risk.fda_risk_category: No evidence of toxicity in humans or animals
pregnancy_risk.lactation: No data, but adverse effects not expected. Monitor infant for GI toxicity.
